faces and interactions are all gamified

they don't seem unpopular the whole
picture of who we are online is being

nudged to post content that gets more

stuff that makes other people addicted
to our feeds something as seemingly
frivolous as a selfie can actually push
a lot of addictive psychological buttons
the same picture can elicit feelings of
admiration Envy disdain and self-doubt
sometimes all at the same time taking a
